The video evidence: The expert analyzed the video that was shared along with the claim. They determined that the video showed a man being beaten by police personnel.
Social media posts: The expert examined the Facebook and Twitter posts that accompanied the video. These posts claimed that the person being beaten was one of the accused in the Hyderabad rape and murder case.
Circulation and sharing: The expert noted that the Facebook post had been shared over 7,700 times and that the video had been circulated in the backdrop of the recent rape and murder case. This aspect indicated the widespread dissemination of the claim.
Verification through reverse: searching: The expert used the InVid tool to break up the video into multiple key frames. They then conducted a reverse-search of one of the frames and found an article published in The Hindu dated November 27, 2019. This article provided information about the incident shown in the video, which took place in Chittoor district of Andhra Pradesh, and confirmed that the person seen in the video was not an accused in the Hyderabad rape and murder case.
